Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide your total spend on communications and public relations for the last three financial year's (20/21,21/22,22/23). For each year I would like a breakdown containing the following information:
• Spend on communications and public relations activities.
• Total number of communications and public relations employees.
• Total salary cost for all communications and public relations employees
Yours faithfully,
Liam Porter

Dear Liam Porter,
Thank you for your request for information relating to communications &
public relations spend which we received on 06/03/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 05/04/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Liam Porter,
Thank you for your request for information relating to communications &
public relations spend which we received on 06/03/2024.
Please provide your total spend on communications and public relations for
the last three financial year's (20/21,21/22,22/23). For each year I would
like a breakdown containing the following information:
• Spend on communications and public relations activities.
The council has an in-house communications team that handles the vast
majority of communications and PR work.
Any additional agency Communications and PR spend on major projects will
usually be part of a wider contract, and as such there is no specific
breakdown available. Our system will not identify if part of a wider
contract relates to communications or PR.
As a council we also bid for external funding for PR work, when grants or
funding are available from other parties, such as central government, at
no cost to the council.
• Total number of communications and public relations employees.
The below figures reflect employees in the corporate communications team.
There may be others elsewhere in the organisation who have communications
as part of their wider role but may not be easily identifiable from the
job title alone.
There may also have been people on short-term/temporary contracts who were
paid for by external funding, rather than through Council budgets (such as
government grants for a specific project).
Year 20/21 – 31.62 Full Time Equivalent
Year 21/22 – 37.62 Full Time Equivalent
Year 22/23 – 25.56 Full Time Equivalent
• Total salary cost for all communications and public relations employees
Year 20/21 – £1,197,772.63
Year 21/22 – £1,463,537.55
Year 22/23 – £1,011,598.35
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
